column4: does anybody know how to ssh to a remote computer and keep my keyboard configurations on the remote computer? Because when I ssh to the remote computer there are some keyboards that are disabled such as backspace, enter, arrow..

does anybody know how to ssh to a remote computer and keep my keyboard configurations on the remote computer? Because when I ssh to the remote computer there are some keyboards that are disabled such as backspace, enter, arrow..
an extremely configureable cross-platform ssh client http://soark.whitestar.greenend.co.uk
because SSH is basically a terminal emulation program
no, I run putty on Linux TRUST ME ON THIS
so how do I run on linux?
~:$ sudo apt-get update; apt-get install putty putty-tools pterm
do you have the multiverse and universe repositories enabled?
please quit repeating.  Your question has been answered (several times)
that's probably because you never enabled the multiverse repositories
you have to CONFIGURE putty -- surf around in the GUI and read the docs.  There are plenty
